1.brief: the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
an action (good or bad); generally, a transaction; abstractly, activity; by implication, a product (specifically, a poem) or (generally) property
the tongue (of man or animals), used literally (as the instrument of licking, eating, or speech), and figuratively (speech, an ingot, a fork of flame, a cove of water)
properly, to score with a mark as a tally or record, i.e. (by implication) to inscribe, and also to enumerate; intensively, to recount, i.e. celebrate

2.brief: properly, to be bright, i.e. (by implication) beautiful
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
ruddy i.e. a human being (an individual or the species, mankind, etc.)
properly, to pour out (transitive or intransitive); by implication, to melt or cast as metal; by extension, to place firmly, to stiffen or grow hard
graciousness, i.e. subjective (kindness, favor) or objective (beauty)
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to kneel; by implication to bless God (as an act of adoration), and (vice-versa) man (as a benefit); also (by euphemism) to curse (God or the king, as treason)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

3.brief: to gird on (as a belt, armor, etc.)
drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
the thigh (from its fleshy softness); by euphemistically the generative parts; figuratively, a shank, flank, side
grandeur (i.e. an imposing form and appearance)

4.brief: to push forward, in various senses (literal or figurative, transitive or intransitive)
to ride (on an animal or in a vehicle); causatively, to place upon (for riding or generally), to despatch
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
properly, to flow as water (i.e. to rain); transitively, to lay or throw (especially an arrow, i.e. to shoot); figuratively, to point out (as if by aiming the finger), to teach
to fear; morally, to revere; caus. to frighten
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south

5.brief: properly, a piercer, i.e. an arrow; by implication, a wound; figuratively, (of God) thunderbolt; the shaft of aspear
to point (transitive or intransitive); intensively, to pierce; figuratively, to inculcate
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
to fall, in a great variety of applications (intransitive or causative, literal or figurative)
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

6.brief: properly, covered, i.e. a throne (as canopied)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan

a level, i.e. a plain (often used (with the article prefix) as a proper name of certain districts); figuratively, concord; also straightness, i.e. (figuratively) justice (sometimes adverbially, justly)
a scion, i.e. (literally) a stick (for punishing, writing, fighting, ruling, walking, etc.) or (figuratively) a clan

7.brief: to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)
the right (natural, moral or legal); also (abstractly) equity or (figuratively) prosperity
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to rub with oil, i.e. to anoint; by implication, to consecrate; also to paint

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
grease, especially liquid (as from the olive, often perfumed); figuratively, richness

8.brief: myrrh (as distilling in drops, and also as bitter)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a large public building, such as a palace or temple
a tooth (as sharp); specifically  ivory; figuratively, a cliff
a musical chord (as parted into strings)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

9.brief: a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
to station, in various applications (literally or figuratively)
the right hand or side (leg, eye) of a person or other object (as the stronger and more dexterous); locally, the south
properly, something carved out, i.e. ore; hence, gold (pure as originally mined)
Ophir, the name of a son of Joktan, and of a gold region in the East

10.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)
to stretch or spread out; by implication, to bend away (including moral deflection); used in a great variety of application
broadness. i.e. (concrete) the ear (from its form in man)
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application

11.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to depress, i.e. prostrate (especially reflexive, in homage to royalty or God)

12.brief: a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
a donation; euphemistically, tribute; specifically a sacrificial offering (usually bloodless and voluntary)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
properly, to be rubbed or worn; hence (figuratively) to be weak, sick, afflicted; or (causatively) to grieve, make sick; also to stroke (in flattering), entreat
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock

13.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)
a brocade; by analogy, a (reticulated) setting of agem
gold, figuratively, something gold-colored (i.e. yellow), as oil, a clear sky
a garment (literally or figuratively); by implication (euphemistically) a wife

14.brief: properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
a virgin (from her privacy); sometimes (by continuation) a bride; also (figuratively) a city or state
properly, the hind part; generally used as an adverb or conjunction, after (in various senses)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)

15.brief: properly, to flow; causatively, to bring (especially with pomp)
a revolution (of time, i.e. an age); also joy
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a large public building, such as a palace or temple

16.brief: the bottom (as depressed); only adverbially, below (often with prepositional prefix underneath), in lieu of, etc.
father, in a literal and immediate, or figurative and remote application
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
to place (in a very wide application)
a head person (of any rank or class)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
